definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.
sentences.chinese: 坐在城門口的人對我議論紛紛，我成了酒徒之歌。

sentences.english: The new construction is helpful to the environmental protection, obtains Glasgow street corner drunkard to support.
sentences.chinese: 新建築有助於環保，得到格拉斯哥街頭酒徒支持。

sentences.english: The other drinkers take pity on the old fellow .
sentences.chinese: 其他酒徒則對這位老夥計十分同情。

sentences.english: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet
sentences.chinese: 以法蓮高傲的酒徒，他的冠冕，必被踏在腳下。

sentences.english: He gets drunk every day and is a real wino.
sentences.chinese: 他每天都喝得醉醺醺的，是個十足的酒徒。
她公開承認自己是個酒徒。

sentences.english: The social images of the drunkward were not that glamorous.
sentences.chinese: 秦漢時期“酒徒”的社會形象，似乎並不光彩。

sentences.english: His grordaddy is a few-bottle man.
His grandfather is a three-bottle man.
Mr. Bigdrink was lit up like a Christmas tree at the party last night.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的社交晚會上，大酒徒先生喝醉以後高興極了。

sentences.english: He gets drunk every day and is a real wino .
sentences.chinese: 他每天都喝得醉醺醺的，是個十足的酒徒。

definition: great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
the contents of the cup/(fig.) liquor/wine
Qin Mu (1919-1992), educator and prolific writer
Bacchus (the Greek god of wine), aka Dionysus
honored sir (a person of higher status or seniority, or a Buddhist monk)
romance/beautiful scenery/small or petty (of talk etc)
